meanings.definition: Dominiques (noun): a breed of chicken known for its distinctive black and white striped feathers.
meanings.sent1: The dominiques strutted around the farm, showing off their unique feathers.
meanings.sent2: I saw a flock of dominiques pecking at the ground in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The dominiques decided to have a fashion show to display their stylish feathers.
meanings.sent4: The dominiques stood out in the coop like zebra-patterned chickens.
meanings.sent5: The dominiques' feathers resembled a piano keyboard, making them easy to spot.

meanings.definition: Dominiques (adjective): relating to or characteristic of the Dominique breed of chicken.
meanings.sent1: She admired the dominiques' unique coloring as they roamed freely.
meanings.sent2: The farmer raised dominiques for their distinct appearance.
meanings.sent3: The dominiques threw a party to celebrate their one-of-a-kind features.
meanings.sent4: The dominiques' coop looked like a black-and-white painting come to life.
meanings.sent5: The dominiques' feathers were dominiques' best feature, making them easily recognizable.
